body:
Thanks for the pull request! We have recently pushed a commit to Rails that logs every time a callback redirects or renders:

https://github.com/rails/rails/commit/38ab982cfff98570b5f12933cff489364845789c

This should already help your students to identify what was changing the request. The second point that callbacks can be messy to understand in big applications is also valid but I am afraid logging each callback could be unnecessarily expensive. So maybe we could merge your patch but without a default implementation for log_callback. If one desires, he coud then override and implement it as needed.

/cc @jeremy @wycats
